reviews.review_msg: Ive had him for a couple classes and I was kinda happy I had him for this one. He is very understanding and actually wants success for his students. Go to class because phil papers are difficult to understand properly. Marking is reasonable. Great with articulating ideas and delivery. Likes to talk and likes people in general.

Truly the best professor I've ever had. Prof Begby is a fantastic lecturer, very understanding, and accessible outside of class. He gives great advice during office hours and is always willing to explain things in greater detail when you don't understand! Could not recommend enough.

Endre is one of the best profs I've had. While lectures can be bland sometimes, he gives great feedback and is very open during office hours to provide any help for papers. A reasonable marker too. Definitely recommend taking a class with Endre no matter what the subject is.

Endre explains the material very well. Personally, I found philosophy of language a bit harder than other courses but I still got a good general overview of the relevant issues from going to lectures. He is also surprising chill and fun to talk to.

He was enthusiastic and well informed, and he looked at essay drafts.  But his comments on the drafts were snipey and of no help at all.  He also went too fast, and I lost information for his speed and somewhat sloppy English.  Anyways, take him if you want.

Easily the worst professor in the SFU philosophy department. Going to class, although essential to receiving any information for the 3 total assignments, was practically a time for Martin to show off how smart he was and how philosophy of language is supposedly the most important type of philosophy. I regret taking this course.

Lectures are totally confusing. He talks fast and quietly, often misspeaks and writes stuff on the board incorrectly. Picks super hard readings. Jumps around from topic to topic, philosopher to philosopher. Doesn't do what he says he will. Does the bear minimum. Leaves rude comments on your assignments. Nice guy, terrible prof.
